permissions: Any authenticated user; policy allows create for all users.
side_effects: Computes cycle time comparison metrics from material transactions and caches results for up to 1 day.
validation_notes: coordinates-one and coordinates-two must be JSON arrays of two numbers [lat,lon] with latitude between -90 and 90 and longitude between -180 and 180. proximity-meters is required and must be a number greater than 0. cycle-count, if provided, must be a positive integer (empty or non-positive values are rejected). transaction-at-min and transaction-at-max should be ISO8601 timestamps; server parses them before query execution.

flags.name: --coordinates-one
flags.description: JSON array [lat,lon] for the first point (required). Example: [37.7749,-122.4194].
flags.validation: Must be valid JSON array [lat,lon] with latitude between -90 and 90 and longitude between -180 and 180.

flags.name: --coordinates-two
flags.description: JSON array [lat,lon] for the second point (required). Example: [37.8044,-122.2712].
flags.validation: Must be valid JSON array [lat,lon] with latitude between -90 and 90 and longitude between -180 and 180.

flags.name: --proximity-meters
flags.description: Radius in meters for nearby sites (required). Example: 5000.
flags.validation: Must be a number greater than 0.

flags.name: --transaction-at-min
flags.validation: Must be an ISO8601 timestamp if provided.

flags.name: --transaction-at-max
flags.validation: Must be an ISO8601 timestamp if provided.

flags.name: --cycle-count
flags.description: Limit number of cycles sampled (integer). Example: 250.
flags.validation: Must be a positive integer when provided.
